summary: Implements a context manager that activates an alarm signal to interrupt longâ€‘running system calls in the main thread. Upon entering, it sets up the signal handler; exiting restores the previous state. The alarm is translated into an exception, and a cancel method can trigger the interruption manually.
business_intent: Enable applications to enforce timeouts and gracefully abort blocking operations in the main thread, improving responsiveness and preventing hangs during I/O or other system calls.
